meanings.sent1: She was cradling the injured bird in her hands.
meanings.sent2: The mother was cradling her newborn baby in her arms.
meanings.sent3: He cradled the fragile vase as if it were made of glass.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter cradled the kitten rescued from the tree.
meanings.sent5: The old man cradled his memories close to his heart.

meanings.definition: Support or protect in a way that resembles cradling
meanings.sent1: The hammock was cradling him gently as he swayed back and forth.
meanings.sent2: The giant hands of the statue cradled the small village below.
meanings.sent3: The clouds seemed to cradle the sun as it set in the horizon.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the tree cradled the nest of baby birds.
meanings.sent5: The soft pillow cradled her head as she drifted off to sleep.

meanings.definition: To lie or be situated in a cradle or similar structure
meanings.sent1: The boat was cradling in the calm waters of the bay.
meanings.sent2: The phone was cradling in its charging dock on the nightstand.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cradling in the cozy basket by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The flower was cradling in the curve of the vase on the table.
meanings.sent5: The toy car was cradling in the palm of the child's hand.
